{{Infobox Radio Station | name = Southern Star| image = [[Image:Southern star logo.png]]| area = [[New Zealand]]| branding = Southern Star| slogan = Great music, good company and a message of hope.| airdate = | frequency = | format = [[Christian music]]| erp = | class = Terrestrial/Internet| owner = [[Rhema Broadcasting Group]]| webcast = [http://www1.streaming.net.nz/meta/rbg-sstar.asx Listen Live]
(Windows Media player needed)| website = [http://www.sstar.co.nz www.sstar.co.nz]| callsign_meaning = | }} '''Southern Star''' is a [[New Zealand]] [[Christian]] [[radio network]] that plays classic [[contemporary Christian music]] and [[hymns]]. It also broadcasts features from [[Chuck Swindoll]], [[Derek Prince]] and [[Max McLean]] about the [[Bible]] and [[God]]. The station is operated by the [[Rhema Broadcasting Group]] on a range of frequencies across New Zealand as well as on [[Radio New Zealand]]'s [[AM Network]] when [[New Zealand Parliament| Parliament]] is not being broadcast. ==AM Network stations== [[AM Network]] stations relay Southern Star programming when [[New Zealand Parliament|Parliament]] is not sitting. ===North Island=== * [[Auckland]] 882 AM * [[Waikato]] 1494 AM * [[Hawke's Bay]] 909 AM * [[Wellington]] 657 AM ===South Island=== * [[Canterbury]] 963 AM * [[Otago]] 900 AM * [[Southland Region|Southland]] 1314 AM ==Southern Star stations== In several areas without an [[AM Network]] station there are Southern Star stations broadcasting twenty four hours of programming. ===North Island=== * [[Tauranga]] 657 AM * [[Bay Of Plenty]] 657 AM * [[Gisborne]] 92.5 FM * [[Taupo]] 88.0 FM * [[New Plymouth]] 666 AM * [[Masterton]] 100.7 FM ===South Island=== * [[Nelson, New Zealand|Nelson]] 612 AM * [[Murchison, New Zealand|Murchison]] 88.3 FM * [[Ashburton, New Zealand|Ashburton]] 106.9 FM * [[Timaru]] 981 AM * [[Mosgiel]] 88.6 FM * [[Alexandra, New Zealand|Alexandra]] 88.2 FM * [[Cromwell, New Zealand|Cromwell]] 87.6 FM * [[Wanaka]] 87.7 FM * [[Queenstown, New Zealand|Queenstown]] 107.0 FM * [[Te Anau]] 89.6 FM ==Programming== ===Previous Shows and Hosts=== {| border="0" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="2" |- !
